com.lucaslouca.util

Class LLDirectedGraph<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.lucaslouca.util.LLDirectedGraph<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type of graphs's the nodes. For example a LLTown.

    public class LLDirectedGraph<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing a generic directed graph.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  LLDirectedGraph.GraphPath
      An instance of GraphPath represents a path containing the nodes in the order in which they have been traversed.
      static class  LLDirectedGraph.NodeNotReachableException
      Exception that is thrown when a node in the graph is not reachable.

        Check whether graphs contains given node.
        Parameters:
        node - node to check whether it is contained in this graph.

      • addEdge

        public void addEdge(T start,
                    T dest,
                    int weight)
        Add an unidirectional edge from a given start node to a destination node.
        Parameters:
        start - the node with outgoing edge.
        dest - the node with the incoming edge.
        weight - the weight of the edges between the two nodes.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if one or both nodes don't exist.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if weight is less than 0.

      • removeEdge

        public void removeEdge(T start,
                       T dest)
        Remove an edge from the graph.
        Parameters:
        start - the node with outgoing edge.
        dest - the node with the incoming edge.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if one or both graph don't exist.

      • getNeighbours

        public java.util.Set<T> getNeighbours(T node)
        Get all the adjacent graph of the given node.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to retrieve the neighbors from.
        Returns:
        Set of neighbors.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if node doesn't exist.

      • edgeExists

        public boolean edgeExists(T start,
                          T dest)
        Given two graph in the graph, returns whether there is an edge from the first node to the second node. If either node does not exist in the graph, throws a NoSuchElementException.
        Parameters:
        start - the start node.
        dest - the destination node.
        Returns:
        whether there is an edge from start to end.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if either endpoint does not exist.

      • getNodes

        public java.util.Set<T> getNodes()
        Nodes of graph.
        Returns:
        Set containing all graph in the graph.

      • shortestPathBetween

        public LLDirectedGraph.GraphPath shortestPathBetween(T start,
                                                     T dest)
                                              throws LLDirectedGraph.NodeNotReachableException
        Get GraphPath representing the shortest path between start and dest.
        Parameters:
        start - start node.
        dest - node which we want to reach.
        Returns:
        GraphPath representing the shortest path between start and dest.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if either node does not exist in the graph.
        LLDirectedGraph.NodeNotReachableException - if dest is unreachable.

      • distance

        public int distance(java.util.List<T> nodes)
             throws LLDirectedGraph.NodeNotReachableException
        Get total distance of route.
        Parameters:
        nodes - array of nodes as they should be traversed.
        Returns:
        total distance of route.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if a node in the route does not exist in the graph.
        LLDirectedGraph.NodeNotReachableException - if node is unreachable.

      • countRoutesWithMaxHops

        public int countRoutesWithMaxHops(T start,
                                  T dest,
                                  int maxHops)
        Count number of possible routes starting from start and ending at dest with a maximum number of maxHops.
        Parameters:
        start - starting node of route.
        dest - destination node of route.
        maxHops - maximum number of stops in route.
        Returns:
        number of possible routes.

      • countRoutesWithHops

        public int countRoutesWithHops(T start,
                               T dest,
                               int hops)
        Count number of possible routes starting from start and ending at dest with a exactly number of hops.
        Parameters:
        start - starting node of route.
        dest - destination node of route.
        hops - number of stops in route.
        Returns:
        number of possible routes.

      • countRoutesWithMaxDistance

        public int countRoutesWithMaxDistance(T start,
                                      T dest,
                                      int distance)
        Count number of possible routes starting from start and ending at dest with a distance less equal to distance.
        Parameters:
        start - starting node of route.
        dest - destination node of route.

        Returns:
        number of possible routes.
